result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

(12:49 PM cases 22CM808, 22CM825, 22CF1080 called.) Defendant Kevin R Booth appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Karl A Schmidt appeared by video for Kevin R Booth.  Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Court orders the warrant is quashed.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaints and time limits for preliminary hearing in 22CF1080.
State requests $1,000.00 cash bond to cover all cases and cites reasoning. Attorney Schmidt requests signature bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $500.00 cash bond with conditions to cover all cases.
Defendant updates address and phone number with the Court.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on October 24, 2022 at 3:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
For Initial Appearance on October 5, 2022 at 11 AM.
